item.description:

o =( well idk either are u sure u havent missed anything :public void checkwildy() { if((absX >= 2518 && absX <=2531 && absY >= 4746 && absY <=4786)) { inwildy = true; } else { inwildy = false; } } public void checkwildy2() { if((absX >= 3208 && absX <=3217 && absY >= 3486 && absY <=2343)) { inwildy2 = true; } else { inwildy2 = true; } } public void checkwildy3() { if((absX >= 3216 && absX <= 3209 && absY >= 3485 && absY <= 3478)) { inwildy = true; } else { inwildy = false; } } public void checkwildy4() { if((absX >= 3216 && absX <= 3209 && absY >= 3485 && absY <= 3478)) { inwildy2 = true; } else { inwildy2 = false; } }

item.title: A idea!
item.dc:creator: @eekz eekz
item.description:
@eekz wrote:

Step 1:
Open up your client.java and search for

public void checkwildy()

You will see

public void checkwildy() { if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3672)) { inwildy = false; } else { inwildy = true; } } public void checkwildy2() { if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3514)) { inwildy2 = false; } else { inwildy2 = true; } }

after add this

public void checkwildy3() { if((absX >= 3216 && absX <= 3209 && absY >= 3485 && absY <= 3478)) { inwildy = true; } else { inwildy = false; } } public void checkwildy4() { if((absX >= 3216 && absX <= 3209 && absY >= 3485 && absY <= 3478)) { inwildy2 = true; } else { inwildy2 = false; } }

Read full topic

item.title: A idea!
item.dc:creator: @eekz eekz
item.description:
@eekz wrote:

iownuall ill teach you

here it goes
Step 1:
Search for this in you client.JAVA file

public boolean nonWild()

you should see under it this line or a line simalar

if((absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3258 && absY >= 3438 && absY <=3431 )heightLevel == 1)

lets say you want to make the fountain next to the east ban a safe zone you start here at the south-west of the area you want as a safe zone:

see the co-ord says 3236, 3432. you use the first coord(the x axis) as the first co-ord in the client.java.

e.g:

if((absX >= 3236 && absX <= xaxis && absY >= yaxis && absY <= yaxis )

and the second co-ord(the Yaxis) as the first y axis

if((absX >= 3236 && absX <= xaxis && absY >= 3423 && absY <= yaxis)

and for the other axis walk to the north east corner

see the axis 3241, 3437

the x axis there is the 2nd in the client and the y is the second in cline so all together it should look like

if((absX >= 3236 && absX <= 3241 && absY >= 3423 && absY <= 3437)

and would u look at that, the fountain is now safe.

Read full topic
